assessments.title: Online Drinking Water Compliance Monitoring System
assessments.description_text:
The Department of Natural Resources is posting this Request for Proposal (eRFP) to establish a contract with a qualified supplier who will provide an Online Drinking Water Compliance Monitoring System as per the Scope of Work.

Please note that your company must be registered in Team Georgia Marketplace to fully view and respond to this bid.  For more details on registering and bidding, please click on the Quick Reference Guide link at the top of this bid announcement on the Georgia Procurement Registry.

Also, it is extremely important that you fully read the eRFP Instructions posted with this bid.

If you experience any technical difficulties in responding to the bid or accessing any bid documents, please contact the Team Georgia Marketplace Help Desk at (404)657-6000.

The State of Georgia advises that prospective bidders periodically check the website for modifications to bid documents.  The State of Georgia is not responsible for a prospective bidder¿s misunderstanding of the bid solicitation or nonresponsive bid due to failure to check the website for updates or amendments to bid documents, and/or other information regarding the bid.
assessments.ai_summary:
Background
 The Environmental Protection Division (EPD) of the Georgia Department of Natural Resources is responsible for protecting Georgia's air, land, and water resources through state and federal environmental statutes. 
This Request for Proposal (RFP) aims to replace the outdated Monthly Operating Reports System (MORS) with a Commercial-off-the-Shelf (COTS) Web-based system that includes a customer-facing portal for regulated communities to collect laboratory and operational data from public water supply systems.

Work Details
 The contractor will provide an Online Drinking Water Compliance Monitoring System that includes: 
- A secure web-based application for data entry, receipt, and retention of information generated by plant operators. 
- Integration capabilities with the EPA’s Safe Drinking Water Information System (SDWIS). 
- Features such as compliance tracking, notifications, reporting capabilities, data sharing/exchange, user management, and document management. 
- The system must support 14 agency users and 212 water system users across 106 facilities. 
- Data migration from the existing Oracle 12c database to the new system is required. 
- The solution must meet minimum-security standards of SOC 2 and ISO 27017.

Period of Performance
 The contract will be performed until March 31, 2026.

Place of Performance
 The services will be performed in the State of Georgia.

Bidder Requirements
 Bidders must be registered in Team Georgia Marketplace. 
They are required to comply with E-Verify requirements if providing services with total compensation of $2,500 or greater. 
The contractor must also ensure compliance with laws regarding drug-free workplaces and confidentiality provisions consistent with the Georgia Open Records Act.

assessments.title: RFI - Biocontainment, Isolation, and Quarantine (BIQ) Shipboard Isolation System (SIS)
assessments.description_text:
Note:  This is a follow-on Request for Information (RFI) to two previous Sources Sought Announcements (links provided below) and is requesting more detailed information about readily available or commercial off the shelf (COTS) solutions for a hospital bed isolation system to support the Biocontainment, Isolation, and Quarantine (BIQ) Shipboard Isolation System (SIS) program.


	https://sam.gov/opp/d2ddfa1fb4694c4eb83a33ba50085882/view, posted 11 SEP 2023 through 31 OCT 2023
	https://sam.gov/opp/9d48079a6e6f41819578ab491a4c06f1/view, posted 06 AUG 2024 through 08 NOV 2024




Synopsis: The purpose of this RFI is to obtain detailed information to assist the Joint Project Manager for Chemical, Biological, Radiological, and Nuclear Protection (JPM CBRN Protection) in identifying readily available or COTS systems for the BIQ SIS program.  The system will temporarily enclose and isolate an infectious patient confined to a hospital bed on a U.S. Navy ship to control and prevent the spread of biological threats (biothreats).



The U.S. Government requests that responses be submitted via email ONLY to Brian Liska at brian.liska@usmc.mil no later than 10 SEP 2025 by 5:00 p.m. EST.



Background: To address the goals and objectives of the Chemical and Biological Defense Program (CBDP) Enhanced Biodefense and Pandemic Preparedness Narrative and the National Biodefense Strategy and Implementation Plan, JPM CBRN Protection is in need of a system to temporarily isolate an infectious patient confined to a hospital bed on a U.S. Navy ship. This RFI is issued to determine what solutions are available, and to obtain details about these systems to determine if they may be suitable for military use.



Description: This isolation system must be able to be erected quickly to temporarily isolate an infectious patient confined to a hospital bed in a shipboard environment.  The system must include an air filtration system to generate a negative pressure inside the enclosure, produce sufficient air changes inside the enclosure, and filter exhaust air from the enclosure.  Other features such as, but not limited to, inlet air filters, glove ports, pass-thru interfaces, and windows are needed for healthcare workers to provide care to the patient.



Programs: This RFI is in support of the SIS program, which is one of the three BIQ programs managed by JPM CBRN Protection.  Requirements for the system are currently being developed.



Government Furnished Property: None



Responses: Interested parties are invited to submit a response to this RFI.



This RFI is issued solely for information and planning purposes and to identify potential readily available or COTS solutions. THIS IS NOT A SOLICITATION. No contract will be awarded from this RFI. This RFI does not constitute a Request for Proposal (RFP) or a promise to issue an RFP in the future. It is subject to change and is not binding on the U.S. Government. Further, unsolicited proposals will not be accepted. Funding is not available at this time. The U.S. Government has not made a commitment to procure any of the items/services discussed, and release of this RFI should not be construed as such a commitment or as authorization to incur cost for which reimbursement would be required or sought. Response to this RFI is voluntary and no reimbursement will be made for any costs associated with providing information in response to this and any follow-on information requests. All submissions become U.S. Government property and will not be returned.



Not responding to this RFI does not preclude participation in any future RFP(s) if any is(are) issued.



Interested parties may identify their interest by submitting a white paper regarding this RFI to JPM CBRN Protection via e-mail ONLY to Brian Liska at brian.liska@usmc.mil no later than 10 SEP 2025 by 5:00 p.m. EST.  Please include the following information in the white paper:


	Please provide system description(s) and image(s).
	What is the size and weight of the system?
	What is the cost and delivery lead time for 1 system up to 10 systems?
	What is the location of the manufacturing facility?  Are any system components/parts sourced outside of the United States and if so, where?
	What is the shelf life and recommended storage conditions of the system?
	Is the system a prototype, commercial off the shelf, or government off the shelf?
	What negative pressure (in inches of water column/gauge) is maintained inside the enclosure (i.e., the enclosed patient isolation area)?
	How many air changes per hour are maintained inside the enclosure?
	What media is used to filter the inlet and exhaust air (e.g., HEPA, ULPA, MERV-14)?
	What is the power source for the system (e.g., rechargeable battery, non-rechargeable battery, 120 VAC, 240VAC)?  If there is more than one power source, then please list all of them.  Please provide battery model numbers.  How many hours can the system continuously operate using each power source?
	What EMI testing has been performed on the system (e.g., MIL-STD-461, MIL-STD-464)?
	What features are incorporated in the system to prevent liquids (e.g., blood, urine, vomit) from leaking out of the enclosure (e.g., leakproof zipper, absorbent pad)?  Additionally, what volume of liquid can be contained within the enclosure?
	Has the system been tested for compatibility with any decontaminants (e.g., Calla 1452, 9% calcium hypochlorite and seawater solution, Joint General-Purpose Decontaminant)?
	What is the minimum and maximum temperature and relative humidity that the system can be operated in?
	Has the system been tested in any adverse environmental conditions (e.g., sand, fungus, salt spray/fog, rain)?
	What material testing has been performed (e.g., tear strength, puncture resistance)?
	Is PFAS contained in any component used in the system?
	Are storage containers provided to protect the system from corrosion due to exposure to salt-laden air/water when it is stowed?  What is the size and weight of the system when it is being stowed?
	Has any shock and/or vibration testing been performed on the system?  If yes, then please indicate which standards were used (e.g., MIL-STD-810H, MIL-DTL-901E, MIL-STD-167-1A).
	Is there a way to secure the hospital bed within the system?
	How many people are required and how long does it take to setup the system?  How many people are required to operate the system?




NOTE:  Specification sheets, reports, and/or manuals may be included with the white paper.



The U.S. Government will not pay for any information or administrative cost incurred in response to this RFI. All costs associated with responding to this RFI will be solely at the expense of the interested party.


Questions: Any questions for clarification may be emailed to Brian Liska at brian.liska@usmc.mil no later than five business days before 10 SEP 2025. Please allow three business days for a response. Verbal questions will NOT be accepted. Questions shall NOT contain proprietary or classified information. An unattributed list of questions and answers will be published at the same web location of this RFI.

assessments.title: RFI -Biocontainment, Isolation, and Quarantine (BIQ) Portable Patient Transport System (PPTS)
assessments.description_text:
Note:  This is a follow-on Request for Information (RFI) to two previous Sources Sought Announcements (links provided below) and is requesting more detailed information about readily available or commercial off the shelf (COTS) solutions for a single (non-ambulatory) patient system to support the Biocontainment, Isolation, and Quarantine (BIQ) Portable Patient Transport System (PPTS) program.


	https://sam.gov/opp/d2ddfa1fb4694c4eb83a33ba50085882/view, posted 11 SEP 2023 through 31 OCT 2023
	https://sam.gov/opp/9d48079a6e6f41819578ab491a4c06f1/view, posted 06 AUG 2024 through 08 NOV 2024




Synopsis: The purpose of this RFI is to obtain detailed information to assist the Joint Project Manager for Chemical, Biological, Radiological, and Nuclear Protection (JPM CBRN Protection) in identifying readily available or COTS solutions for a single (non-ambulatory) patient system to support the BIQ PPTS program. This man-portable system will control and prevent the spread of biological threats (biothreats) while transporting a single, non-ambulatory infectious patient by air, rail, ground transport, or sealift.



The U.S. Government requests that responses be submitted via email ONLY to Brian Liska at brian.liska@usmc.mil no later than 10 SEP 2025 by 5:00 p.m. EST.



Background: To address the goals and objectives of the Chemical and Biological Defense Program (CBDP) Enhanced Biodefense and Pandemic Preparedness Narrative and the National Biodefense Strategy and Implementation Plan, JPM CBRN Protection is in need of a man-portable system to control and prevent the spread of biothreats while transporting a non-ambulatory infectious patient. This RFI is issued to determine what solutions are available, and to obtain details about these systems to determine if they may be suitable for military use.



Description: This single (non-ambulatory) patient BIQ transport system must be man-portable and will consist of an enclosure for the infectious patient with an attached battery-powered air filtration system to generate a negative pressure inside the enclosure, provide sufficient air changes inside the enclosure, and filter exhaust air from the enclosure.  Other features such as, but not limited to, inlet air filters, glove ports, pass-thru interfaces, and windows are needed for healthcare workers to provide care to the patient during transport.



Programs: This RFI is in support of the PPTS program, which is one of the three BIQ programs managed by JPM CBRN Protection.  Requirements for the single (non-ambulatory) patient system are currently being developed, and a validated requirements document is anticipated in Fiscal Year 2026.



Government Furnished Property: None



Responses: Interested parties are invited to submit a response to this RFI.



This RFI is issued solely for information and planning purposes and to identify potential COTS solutions. THIS IS NOT A SOLICITATION. No contract will be awarded from this RFI. This RFI does not constitute a Request for Proposal (RFP) or a promise to issue an RFP in the future. It is subject to change and is not binding on the U.S. Government. Further, unsolicited proposals will not be accepted. Funding is not available at this time. The U.S. Government has not made a commitment to procure any of the items/services discussed, and release of this RFI should not be construed as such a commitment or as authorization to incur cost for which reimbursement would be required or sought. Response to this RFI is voluntary and no reimbursement will be made for any costs associated with providing information in response to this and any follow-on information requests. All submissions become U.S. Government property and will not be returned.



Not responding to this RFI does not preclude participation in any future RFP(s) if any is(are) issued.



Interested parties may identify their interest by submitting a white paper regarding this RFI to JPM CBRN Protection via e-mail ONLY to Brian Liska at brian.liska@usmc.mil no later than 10 SEP 2025 by 5:00 p.m. EST.  Please include the following information in the white paper:


	Please provide system description(s) and image(s).
	What is the size and weight of the system?
	What is the cost and delivery lead time for 1 system up to 50 systems?
	What is the location of the manufacturing facility?  Are any system components/parts sourced outside of the United States and if so, where?
	What is the shelf life and recommended storage conditions of the system?
	Is the system a prototype, commercial off the shelf, or government off the shelf?
	What negative pressure (in inches of water column/gauge) is maintained inside the enclosure (i.e., the enclosed patient isolation area)?
	How many air changes per hour are maintained inside the enclosure?
	What media is used to filter the inlet/exhaust air (e.g., HEPA, ULPA, MERV-14)?
	What is the power source for the system (e.g., rechargeable battery, non-rechargeable battery, 120 VAC)?  If there is more than one power source, then please list all of them.  Please provide battery model numbers.  How many hours can the system continuously operate using each power source?
	What EMI testing has been performed on the system (e.g., MIL-STD-461, MIL-STD-464)?
	What features are incorporated in the system to prevent liquids (e.g., blood, urine, vomit) from leaking out of the enclosure (e.g., leakproof zipper, absorbent pad)?  Additionally, what volume of liquid can be contained within the enclosure?
	Has the system been tested for compatibility with any decontaminants (e.g., Calla 1452, 2% calcium hypochlorite solution, Joint General-Purpose Decontaminant)?
	What is the minimum and maximum temperature and relative humidity that the system can be operated in?
	Has the system been tested in any adverse environmental conditions (e.g., sand, smoke, fungus, salt spray/fog, rain)?
	What material testing has been performed (e.g., tear strength, puncture resistance)?
	What platforms (e.g., ambulance, aircraft) can be used to transport the system in the patient movement configuration (i.e., when a patient is inside the enclosure)?
	What military and/or commercial aircraft has the system been certified for airworthiness?
	What litters is the system compatible with (e.g., NATO litter, DECON litter, stokes litter, SKED litter)?  If unknown, then please provide the exterior dimensions of the system.
	Is PFAS contained in any component used in the system?




NOTE:  Specification sheets, reports, and/or manuals may be included with the white paper.



The U.S. Government will not pay for any information or administrative cost incurred in response to this RFI. All costs associated with responding to this RFI will be solely at the expense of the interested party.


Questions: Any questions for clarification may be emailed to Brian Liska at brian.liska@usmc.mil no later than five business days before 10 SEP 2025. Please allow three business days for a response. Verbal questions will NOT be accepted. Questions shall NOT contain proprietary or classified information. An unattributed list of questions and answers will be published at the same web location of this RFI.

assessments.title: NATO Request for Information: Ballistic Missile Defense (BMD) Real Time (RT) System
assessments.description_text:
The NATO Communications and Information Agency (NCIA) has issued a Request for Information (RFI) to identify potential sources and gather information regarding industry capabilities to support the provision of the Ballistic Missile Defense (BMD) Real Time (RT)  component of the NATO BMD capability. 

The purpose of this RFI is to obtain industry views and to determine the feasibility to procure Off-The-Shelf products, to identify potential solutions, possible suppliers providing the complete capability, or products delivering a subset of the capability that could be integrated into a modularized data centric architecture.

Responses to this RFI will help NCIA’s acquisition planning in refining requirements, identifying capabilities, and shaping the strategy for any future solicitation.

This RFI is issued solely for informational purposes and does not constitute a Request for Proposal, Request for Quotation, or Invitation for Bid.

Responses should be submitted using the attached Excel document. The email address for submitting your responses to NCIA is provided in the RFP attachment. 

Responses are to be submitted no later than 1:00 pm CET on 30 September 2025.

NCIA is hosting an industry event to present additional programmatic and technical aspects of the project, and, to the extent possible, answer questions related to this RFI. NCIA has tentatively scheduled this event on or about the week of 15 September 2025 and intends to hold it in a virtual format to reach a wider audience.

NCIA intends to allow participation from responders who missed the original 13 August deadline to register for the Industry Event planned in September. Any industrial entity that is located in a NATO nation and is interested in participating in this industry event is kindly requested to notify its interest by email to the address indicated in the RFP by stating the name of the firm, telephone number, e-mail address, and company POC. Firms are kindly requested to express their interest as soon as practicable.

Your participation in this RFI is greatly appreciated.
assessments.ai_summary:
Background
 The NATO Communications and Information Agency (NCIA) has issued a Request for Information (RFI) to identify potential sources and gather information regarding industry capabilities to support the provision of the Ballistic Missile Defense (BMD) Real Time (RT) component of the NATO BMD capability. 

The purpose of this RFI is to obtain industry views and determine the feasibility of procuring Off-The-Shelf products, identifying potential solutions, and possible suppliers that can provide complete or modular capabilities. This RFI is solely for informational purposes and does not constitute a Request for Proposal, Request for Quotation, or Invitation for Bid.

Work Details
 The RFI seeks capabilities to support the BMD RT component of NATO's BMD capability. 

It aims to gather industry views on the project and assess the feasibility of procuring Off-The-Shelf products, including both commercial and government options. The responses will assist NCIA in refining requirements, identifying capabilities, and shaping future solicitation strategies. 

The BMD RT System is part of the Battle Management, Command, Control Communications and Information (BMC3I) framework, enabling key tactical functions such as Surveillance, Engagement Operations, Situational Awareness, and Tasking. The system will be deployed on both static and deployable NATO Command Structure entities and will provide services at NCS locations alongside AirC2 RT systems to ensure comprehensive coverage against ballistic threats.

Place of Performance
 The contract will be performed in locations associated with NATO Command Structure entities.

assessments.title: 16--GUIDE WINCH ASSY,AI, IN REPAIR/MODIFICATION OF
assessments.description_text: CONTACT INFORMATION|4|N732.76|N00383|771-229-2959|liam.f.cunningham2.civ@us.navy.mil|ITEM UNIQUE IDENTIFICATION AND VALUATION (JAN 2023)|19||||||||||||||||||||HIGHER-LEVEL CONTRACT QUALITY REQUIREMENT|8|x||||||||WIDE AREA WORKFLOW PAYMENT INSTRUCTIONS (JAN 2023)|16|Invoice and Receiving Report Combo|Invoice and Receiving Report Combo|TBD|N00383|TBD|TBD|See schedule|TBD|See schedule||||||||NAVY USE OF ABILITYONE SUPPORT CONTRACTOR - RELEASE OF OFFEROR INFORMATION (3-18))|1||WARRANTY OF SUPPLIES OF A NONCOMPLEX NATURE (JUN 2003)|6|365 days|45 days of the last delivery under this contract|||||EQUAL OPPORTUITY FOR WORKERS WITH DISABILITIES (JUN 2020)|2|||BUY AMERICAN-FREE TRADE AGREEMENTS-BALANCE OF PAYMENTS PROGRAM-BASIC (FEB 2024)|11||||||||||||LIMITATIONS ON PASS-THROUGH CHARGES (JUN 2020)|1||OFFEROR REPRESENTATIONS AND CERTIFICATIONS--COMMERCIAL PRODUCTS AND COMMERCIALSERVICES (MAR 2025)(DEVIATION 2025-O0003 AND 2025-O0004))|3||||ALTERNATE A, ANNUAL REPRESENTATIONS AND CERTIFICATIONS (OCT 2024)|13||||||||||||||BUY AMERICAN-FREE TRADE AGREEMENTS-BALANCE OF PAYMENTS PROGRAM CERTIFICATE-BASIC (FEB 2024))|5||||||BUY AMERICAN--BALANCE OF PAYMENTS PROGRAM (FEB 2024)|1||ROYALTY INFORMATION (APR 1984)|1||ANNUAL REPRESENTATIONS AND CERTIFICATIONS (MAR 2025)(DEVIATION 2025-O0003 AND 2025-O0004))|12|336413|1250|||||||||||NOTICE OF PRIORITY RATING FOR NATIONAL DEFENSE, EMERGENCY PREPAREDNESS, ANDENERGY PROGRAM USE (APR 2008))|2||A1A|EVALUATION--COMMERCIAL PRODUCTS AND COMMERCIAL SERVICES (NOV 2021)|4|||||This RFQ is for repair requirement.Repair Turnaround Time (RTAT): the resultant contractual delivery requirement is measured from asset Return to the date of asset acceptance under the terms of the contract. For purposes of this section, Return is defined as physical receipt of the F-conditionasset at the contractor's facility as reflected in the Action Date entry in the Commercial Asset Visibility (CAV) system. In accordance with the CAV Statement of Work, the contractor is required to accurately report all transactions by the end of the fifth regular business day after receipt and the Action Date entered in CAV must be dated to reflect the actual date of physical receipt. The Contractor must obtain final inspection and acceptance by the Government for all assets within the RTATs established in this contract.Proposals shall reference the proposed RTAT and any capacity constraints. NAVSUP WSS requests that contractors submit a quote that includes either a firm-fixed price or TT&E pricing as well as estimate costs to repair this item.This contract/delivery order/purchase order/modification is issued by the Government when deposited in the mail, transmitted by facsimile or sent by any electronic commerce method, including email. The Government's acceptance of the contractor's proposalconstitutes bilateral agreement to issue this contract/delivery order/purchase order/modification.\
assessments.ai_summary:
Background
 This solicitation is issued by the NAVSUP Weapon Systems Support (NAVSUP WSS) under the Department of the Navy. The agency's mission is to provide logistics support for naval forces, ensuring that they are equipped and ready to perform their missions. The goal of this contract is to procure repair services for specific equipment, which involves the Guide Winch Assembly.

Work Details
 The contract requires the teardown, evaluation, repair, and/or modification of the following item:
- Item No: 0001
- NSN: 7RH 1680-01-599-1334
- Description: GUIDE WINCH ASSY, AI
- Quantity: 4 EA
- Shelf Life: 0-00
- Made to: 3RWH7 IAW: 04957A01-01

Packaging must comply with MIL-STD-2073. The contractor must ensure that all repairs are completed within the established Repair Turnaround Time (RTAT), which is measured from asset return to acceptance by the government. Proposals must include a firm-fixed price or Time & Materials pricing along with estimated costs for repairs.

Period of Performance
 The period of performance is not explicitly stated in the provided data but is tied to the Repair Turnaround Time (RTAT) which must be proposed by contractors.

Place of Performance
 The place of performance includes the contractor's facility where assets will be received and repaired.

assessments.title: F-22 Cockpit Simulator
assessments.description_text:
Description(s):  REQUEST FOR INFORMATION FOR F-22 COCKPIT SIMULATOR

THIS IS A MARKET SURVEY FOR INFORMATION ONLY. THIS IS NOT A SOLICITATION FOR PROPOSALS AND NO CONTRACT WILL BE AWARDED FROM THIS SYNOPISIS. NO REIMBURSEMENT WILL BE MADE FOR ANY COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH PROVIDING INFORMATION IN RESPONSE TO THIS SYNOPSIS OR ANY FOLLOW-UP INFORMATION REQUESTS. THE PURPOSE OF THIS SYNOPSIS IS TO GAIN KNOWLEDGE OF POTENTIALLY QUALIFIED SOURCES AND THEIR SIZE CLASSIFICATIONS (SMALL BUSINESS, LARGE BUSINESS, ETC.). PLEASE DO NOT REQUEST A COPY OF A SOLICITATION, AS ONE DOES NOT EXIST.   

1.  Purpose.
This is a Request for Information in support of Market Research being conducted by the United States Air Force to identify potential sources for an F-22 Cockpit Simulator

2.  Requirement. 
This acquisition anticipates seeking a contractor who can provide an F-22 Cockpit Simulator at Edwards AFB, CA. The requirement consists of the following supplies:
***PLEASE SEE ATTACHED STATEMENT OF OBJECTIVES (SOO)***

3.  Information requested. 
The Government requests interested offerors that can fully support this requirement furnish the following information:

1. Company name, SAM Unique Entity ID (UEI) and Cage Code, address, points of contact, phone numbers and e-mail addresses.

2. Information should include a market research quote identifying all specifications for each line item. The information package must be clear, concise, and complete. The Air Force is under no obligation to provide feedback to the company, or to contact the company for clarification of any information submitted in response to this request.

3. Identification of business size (small or large) and identify the socioeconomic disadvantaged category, as defined the Federal Acquisition Regulation FAR Part 19 and currently listed in the System for Award Management (SAM). Small business size standards are published by the U.S. Small Business Administration (SBA) and may be found at https://www.sba.gov/document/support-table-size-standards .The potential North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) codes assigned to this procurement is 336413 “Aircraft auxiliary parts (e.g., crop dusting, external fuel tanks, inflight refueling equipment) Manufacturing”. The Small Business Size Standard is 1,250 employees.

4. Any other information deemed useful to the Air Force.  Information packages should be limited to no more than 3 pages.

4.  Inquiries. 
Any qualified and interested companies responding to this announcement must be able to support all areas. NO partial support responses from industry will be accepted.

The due date and time for responses to this synopsis is 7:00am Pacific Standard Time on Friday 15 August 2025.
assessments.ai_summary:
Background
 This Request for Information (RFI) is issued by the United States Air Force as part of market research to identify potential sources for an F-22 Cockpit Simulator. The goal is to gather knowledge about qualified sources and their size classifications, such as small or large businesses. This RFI is not a solicitation for proposals, and no contract will be awarded from this synopsis.

Work Details
 The requirement is for an F-22 Cockpit Simulator to be delivered at Edwards AFB, CA. The supplies needed include: 
- F-22 Simulated Custom Cockpit Seat 
- Harnesses 
- Power Supplies 
- ACU 
- Controller boards 
- F-22 ICP (Quantity 1) at $42,500.00 each 
- F-22 SMFD (Quantity 1) at $19,500.00 each 
Total estimated cost: $487,000. The contractor must ensure that all applicable Commercial-Off-The-Shelf (COTS) IA and IA-enabled products comply with AFI 17-130 and other cybersecurity requirements.

Place of Performance
 Edwards AFB, CA

assessments.title: Snowplow Navigation Guidance System
assessments.description_text: The State of Iowa is seeking snowplow navigation systems to help plow drivers stay in their intended path during snowstorms.
assessments.ai_summary:
Background
 The State of Iowa is seeking to enhance snowplow operations during blizzards and heavy snowfall, which often create whiteout conditions that obscure lane lines and make navigation challenging for plow drivers. The goal of this contract is to procure a commercial-off-the-shelf (COTS) snowplow navigation system that will assist drivers in maintaining their intended path, thereby improving safety and efficiency during snow removal operations.

Work Details
 The contractor will provide a Snowplow Navigation System that includes all necessary components for operation. The system must be capable of providing by-the-inch vehicle positioning to a mapped path, with an in-cab display showing the plow's position and feedback on lateral deviations from the programmed path. Specific requirements include:

- The system must maintain accuracy within four inches at speeds up to thirty-five miles per hour in heavy snowfall conditions.
- It should allow users to mark potential obstacles and provide alerts when the snowplow is near them.
- The system must support communication between multiple units for route sharing.
- Automatic software updates are required, with advance notifications to users.

Period of Performance
 The contract will have an initial term of three years from the date of execution, with an option for the State to renew for up to seven additional one-year terms.

Place of Performance
 The services and delivery of products will take place within the State of Iowa.

Bidder Requirements
 Bidders must comply with specific requirements including providing a Service Level Agreement (SLA), offering installation training, and ensuring availability of service personnel around Iowa. Bidders are also required to submit pricing for various components including service licenses, installation fees, activation fees, and training costs.

assessments.title: Snowplow Navigation Guidance System
assessments.description_text: The State of Iowa is seeking to purchase a commercial-off-the-shelf (COTS) snowplow navigation system to help plow drivers stay in their intended path during snowstorms.
assessments.ai_summary:
Background
 The State of Iowa, through the Division of IT (DOIT), is seeking to procure a commercial-off-the-shelf (COTS) snowplow navigation system. This initiative aims to enhance the efficiency and safety of snowplow operations during blizzards and heavy snowfall, which are common in Iowa. The navigation system will assist plow drivers in maintaining their intended path amidst challenging visibility conditions, thereby reducing the time taken to clear roads and improving overall road safety.

Work Details
 The contract involves providing a COTS snowplow navigation system that includes all necessary components for proper functionality. The system must be capable of providing by-the-inch vehicle positioning to a mapped path, with an in-cab display that alerts operators if the vehicle deviates from its programmed route. Specific requirements include:

- A screen for driver path position checks.
- Visual or audio warnings for path departure.
- Accuracy within four inches at speeds up to 35 miles per hour in heavy snowfall.
- Ability to mark potential obstacles and alert drivers when approaching them.
- Communication capabilities between snowplows equipped with the same system.
- Automatic software updates.

Period of Performance
 The initial contract term is three years from the date of execution, with an option for the State to renew for up to seven additional one-year terms.

Place of Performance
 The services and delivery of products will primarily take place within the State of Iowa.

Bidder Requirements
 Bidders must provide certifications regarding criminal history checks for personnel involved in contract performance. They are also required to submit documentation related to terminations, litigation, and debarment. Additionally, bidders must agree to provide a detailed quarterly sales report and pay a 1.00% administrative fee on all sales made under this contract.
